alert.note: Alert for Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May; Coastal Atlantic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 10:29AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Cape May County through 1100 AM EDT... At 1027 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Woodbine to near Goshen. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ocean City, Somers Point, Margate City, Woodbine, Sea Isle City, Longport, Corbin City, Belleplain Forest, Beesleys Point, Seaville, Marmora, Dennisville, Goshen, Strathmere and Eldora. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 14 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Occasional cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May; Coastal Atlantic
